meanings.definition: The act of disjoining or the state of being disjoined.
meanings.sent1: The disjunction of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete.
meanings.sent2: The disjunction of the two friends caused sadness.
meanings.sent3: The disjunction of the socks in the laundry led to mismatched pairs.
meanings.sent4: The disjunction of the branches created a beautiful pattern against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The disjunction of the road ahead made it difficult to choose the right path.

meanings.definition: A compound proposition that is true if and only if at least one of its components is true.
meanings.sent1: In logic, a disjunction is a statement that is true if any part of it is true.
meanings.sent2: The disjunction of the options allowed for flexibility in decision-making.
meanings.sent3: The disjunction of flavors in the ice cream created a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: The disjunction of opinions in the meeting led to a lively discussion.
meanings.sent5: The disjunction of colors in the painting added depth and contrast.

meanings.definition: The separation of things that are normally connected.
meanings.sent1: The disjunction of the train cars caused delays in the schedule.
meanings.sent2: The disjunction of the power source resulted in a blackout.
meanings.sent3: The disjunction of the internet connection made it impossible to work online.
meanings.sent4: The disjunction of the phone line disrupted communication.
meanings.sent5: The disjunction of the bridge sections created a gap in the pathway.
